https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A characterization of regional caprocks and intraformational barriers (seals) to understand their capacity to trap fluids (oil, gas, etc.); specifically to determine seal capacity (i.e. the capillary pressure, or column height, at which a trapped fluid commences to leak through a seal rock) and conduct fault seal analysis (a measure of the capacity of a fault to leak or seal hydrocarbons).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
Definition adapted from:
Daniel, RF and Kaldi, G 2008, Evaluating seal capacity of caprocks and intraformational barriers for the geosequestration of CO₂: Abstracts for the PESA Eastern Australian Basins Symposium III, Sydney, 14–17 September 2008, p. 475.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: A characterization of regional caprocks and intraformational barriers (seals) to understand their capacity to trap fluids (oil, gas, etc.); specifically to determine seal capacity (i.e. the capillary pressure, or column height, at which a trapped fluid commences to leak through a seal rock) and conduct fault seal analysis (a measure of the capacity of a fault to leak or seal hydrocarbons).
